title: Factoring Out Terms
text: Since all of the terms inclue -x, we can factor it out of the equation: $$-x \left(3x^2+5x+2\right)=0$$.

title: Grouping
text: Now we can factor by grouping. $$2\times3=6$$, so we should look for two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to 5. 2 and 3 satisfy this.

title: Grouping
text: We can rewrite the expression as $$3x^2+3x+2x+2$$ or $$3x^2+3x+2x+2$$. Let's factor $$3x^2+3x$$. 3x goes into both expressions, so let's rewrite this as $$3x \left(x+1\right)$$. Now, factor $$2x+2$$. 2 goes into both terms, so it is rewritten as $$2\left(x+1\right)$$. Because both $$3x \left(x+1\right)$$ and $$2\left(x+1\right)$$ are multiplied by $$x+1$$, we can use the distributive property to rewrite the expression as $$\left(x+1\right) \left(3x+2\right)$$.

title: Zero Product Property
text: Now, we can bring back the -x, making our equation $$-x \left(x+1\right) \left(3x+2\right)$$. Using the Zero Product Property, we can set all the terms equal to zero and solve for x.

title: Zero Product Property
text: What what value of x makes $$-x=0$$?

title: Zero Product Property
text: What what value of x makes $$x+1=0$$?

title: Zero Product Property
text: Subtract 1 from both sides of the equation to get $$x=-1$$.

title: Zero Product Property
text: What what value of x makes $$3x+2=0$$?

title: Zero Product Property
text: Subtract 2 from both sides of the equation, then divide by three to get $$x=\frac{-2}{3}$$.
